sentence.idiomatic: I'm looking forward to Christmas.
Ms. Li isn't looking forward to going to Hong Kong.
Is she looking forward to seeing Mr. Wang? Yes.
Christmas Eve
New Year's Day
New Year's Eve
Chinese New Year
My entire family will be at home.
Will all your friends go to see you? Yes.
Not all students will go to watch the movie.
Ms. Li is a teacher? Really?
He's coming to see me? Really?
I don't like Christmas. Really?
I want to go watch TV.
Do you want to go to Hong Kong? No, I want to go to Shanghai.
It's not that he wants to go to the office.
Ms. Li has to go visit her relatives.
Do you have to go visit your friends? Yes.
I'm not going to visit Mr. Li. I'm going to visit Mr. Wang.
Is that really boring? Yes.
Is this interesting? No.
That's not very interesting.
That's just great.
That's too late.
That's too early.
Ms. Li will give me a call.
Will he give you a gift? Yes.
Mr. Wang will not give him a computer.
the year before last year
this year
next year
I got an iPod from my parents.
Ms. Li got a car from her boyfriend? Yes.
What did you get from them? Nothing.
I’m looking forward to Christmas because my entire family will be at home.
Really？I don’t like Christmas because I have to visit my relatives. That is very boring.
That’s awful! I like Christmas because my relatives will give me nice gifts. I got an iPod from my parents last year. What did u get?
I got a toothbrush from my parents. I don’t like Christmas.
